DOC.brief_summary: This study was designed as a randomized controlled clinical trial to compare conventional orthodontic treatment (control group) and piezocision-assisted orthodontic treatment (PS group). Twenty-four consecutive adult patients from the Orthodontics Department of Liege University Hospital, Belgium who met the inclusion criteria were enrolled from January to October of 2013.
DOC.brief_title: Efficiency of Piezocision-assisted Orthodontic Treatment in Adult Patients
DOC.criteria: Adult patients (completed growth) Maxillary and mandibular overcrowding Patient demand for orthodontic treatment Adequate dentooral health ASA I and ASA II Compliance with clinic visits every 2 weeks A need for tooth extraction A need for orthodontic temporary anchorage devices A history of periodontal disease Smokers Altered bone metabolism (e.g., due to antiresorptive drug, steroid or immunosuppressant use) Mental or motor disabilities Pregnancy
